item.title: M&M's 糖果制造商玛氏将以 360 亿美元收购品客母公司 Kellanova
item.description: 家族拥有的包装食品巨头玛氏公司（旗下糖果品牌包括 M&M's 和士力架）周三表示，将以近 360 亿美元的价格收购品客（Pringles）生产商 Kellanova，这是包装食品行业最大的一笔交易。【原文：Family-owned packaged food giant Mars, whose candy brands include M&M's and Snickers, said on Wednesday it would buy Pringles maker Kellanova for nearly $36 billion in the biggest deal in the packaged food sector.】

item.title: 去中心化人工智能网络 Sahara 在三星支持的新一轮融资中获得新资金
item.description: 集区块链和人工智能于一体的初创企业撒哈拉人工智能公司（Sahara AI）周三表示，该公司在一轮融资中筹集了4300万美元，领投方为风险投资者Pantera Capital、Binance Labs和Polychain Capital。【原文：Sahara AI, a startup integrating the blockchain and artificial intelligence, said on Wednesday it raised $43 million in a funding round led by venture capital investors Pantera Capital, Binance Labs and Polychain Capital.】

item.title: 阿拉斯加航空公司和夏威夷航空公司将拟议交易的审查期延长一天
item.description: 阿拉斯加航空公司（Alaska Air）周三表示，已同意将以 19 亿美元收购同行夏威夷控股公司（Hawaiian Holdings）的审查期延长一天。【原文：Alaska Air said on Wednesday it had agreed to extend by a day the review period of its proposed $1.9 billion acquisition of peer Hawaiian Holdings .】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局结束对 180 万辆丰田 SUV 的初步调查
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周三表示，已结束对约 180 万辆丰田 RAV4 SUV 电池终端短路问题的初步调查。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday that it closed a preliminary investigation into about 1.8 million Toyota RAV4 SUVs over concerns related to short circuits in battery terminals.】

item.title: 华尔街老板对总统候选人特朗普和哈里斯的看法
item.description: 民主党总统候选人卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）和共和党竞争对手唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）在 11 月的总统大选前展开了激烈的角逐，华尔街的一些人正在选边站。以下是我们了解到的华尔街一些顶级老板的倾向。【原文：Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris and Republican rival Donald Trump are locked in a tight race ahead of the November presidential election and some on Wall Street are picking sides. Here's what we know about how some of Wall Street's top bosses are leaning.】

item.title: 经济放缓，美国垃圾债投资者对杠杆贷款持谨慎态度
item.description: 在过去一周市场企稳后，杠杆贷款交易有望回升，不过一些投资者表示，如果经济疲软，他们对垃圾级贷款持谨慎态度。【原文：Leveraged loan deals are expected to pick back up after a stabilization in markets over the past week, although some investors say they are cautious about junk-rated loans if the economy weakens.】

item.title: 早间新闻美国清除通胀障碍，新西兰意外降息
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 以直面危机著称的资深快餐业高管接手星巴克
item.description: 今年早些时候，卷饼制造商奇波特尔（Chipotle）因所谓的缩小分量而在社交媒体上遭到抨击，首席执行官布莱恩-尼科尔（Brian Niccol）做出了惊人的承认：批评该公司的人说得有道理。【原文：When burrito maker Chipotle came under fire on social media for supposedly shrinking portion sizes earlier this year, CEO Brian Niccol made a striking admission: the company's critics had a point.】

item.title: 面对更严格的监管，度假租赁业加大游说力度
item.description: 度假租赁业加大了对美国立法者施加影响的力度，以阻止更多的城市颁布对短期租赁的限制措施，从而回应人们对住房供应和生活质量的担忧。【原文：The vacation rental industry has stepped up efforts to influence U.S. lawmakers to keep more cities from enacting restrictions on short-term rentals in response to concerns about housing availability and quality of life.】

item.title: 洞察力：得克萨斯州石油监管机构受到审查，僵尸油井死灰复燃
item.description: 七月下旬，在佩科斯县一个广阔的牧场上，油井控制专家霍克-邓拉普（Hawk Dunlap）用反铲挖掘出一口废弃的所谓 "僵尸井"，尽管这口井在一年多前刚刚被堵上，但它又重新焕发了生机，向得克萨斯州干燥的泥土中喷出嘶嘶声的气体和有毒的水泡。【原文：On a sprawling ranch in Pecos County in late July, oil well control specialist Hawk Dunlap used a backhoe to uncover an abandoned or so-called zombie well that had sprung back to life despite being plugged just over a year earlier, hissing gas and bubbling toxic water into the dry Texas dirt.】

item.title: Spotify 将在欧盟苹果设备上的应用程序中添加价格信息
item.description: Spotify 将于周三更新其在欧盟地区苹果设备上的应用程序，以包含其各种计划和服务的价格。【原文：Spotify will update its app on Apple devices in the European Union on Wednesday to include prices of its various plans and services, more than three months after the iPhone maker rejected such a move.】

item.title: 在关键的通胀报告发布前，期货市场步履维艰
item.description: 由于投资者谨慎地等待一份关键的通胀报告，以寻找有关美联储降息步伐的线索，与 S&P 500 指数挂钩的期货周三暂停交易，此前该基准指数连续四天上涨。【原文：Futures tied to the S&P 500 paused on Wednesday after the benchmark index logged four straight days of gains as investors cautiously awaited a key inflation report for clues on the pace of interest rate cuts from the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（NHTSA）结束对特斯拉汽车前悬挂故障的调查
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局周三表示，已结束对 74918 辆特斯拉汽车前悬挂故障的初步评估。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Wednesday it has closed a preliminary evaluation into 74,918 Tesla vehicles over front suspension failures.】

item.title: 电动汽车起火造成财产损失，梅赛德斯-奔驰负责人在韩国会见居民
item.description: 梅赛德斯-奔驰（Mercedes-Benz）在韩国的负责人将于周三会见因其电动汽车（EV）起火而受损的公寓大楼的居民。【原文：The head of Mercedes-Benz in South Korea will meet on Wednesday residents of an apartment complex damaged by a fire that started in one of its electric vehicles (EVs) and burned for more than eight hours, stoking public safety fears.】

item.title: 游戏业务复苏，腾讯第二季度收入增长 8
item.description: 中国腾讯控股公司周三公布第二季度收入增长 8%，这主要得益于其游戏业务在 5 月份推出一款新的手机游戏并取得开门红后出现复苏。【原文：China's Tencent Holdings reported a 8% rise in second-quarter revenue on Wednesday, driven by a recovery in its gaming business after a launch of a new mobile game in May that got off to a strong start.】

item.title: 瑞银将出售瑞士信贷的美国抵押贷款服务业务
item.description: 瑞银集团首席财务官托德-塔克纳（Todd Tuckner）周三表示，瑞银周二同意出售瑞士信贷的美国抵押贷款服务业务。【原文：UBS on Tuesday agreed to sell Credit Suisse's U.S. mortgage servicing business, UBS Chief Financial Officer Todd Tuckner said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 蒂森克虏伯与凯雷、德国复兴信贷银行就军舰出售事宜洽谈顺利
item.description: 蒂森克虏伯财务总监延斯-舒尔特（Jens Schulte）周三告诉记者，蒂森克虏伯继续与私募股权公司凯雷（Carlyle）和德国国有贷款机构复兴信贷银行（KFW.UL）就出售其军舰部门的多数股权进行良好的讨论。【原文：Thyssenkrupp continues to be in good discussions with private equity firm Carlyle and German state lender KfW (KFW.UL) over the sale of a majority stake in its warship division, finance chief Jens Schulte told journalists on Wednesday.】

item.title: 受美国利率前景和出口强劲影响，亚洲债券吸引大量资金流入
item.description: 受地区出口强劲增长和美国联邦储备委员会 9 月降息预期的刺激，外国投资者在 7 月份连续第三个月成为亚洲债券的净买家。【原文：Foreign investors were net buyers of Asian bonds for the third consecutive month in July, spurred by strong regional export growth and expectations of a September rate cut by the U.S. Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 中国经济出现新的疲软迹象，中国官员难有喘息机会
item.description: 最近一系列令人沮丧的指标削弱了人们对中国 7 月份经济表现的预期，这是对 2024 年余下时间的一个不祥征兆，也表明除了在世界第二大经济体的痛点上贴膏药之外，还需要更多的刺激措施。【原文：A recent string of dismal indicators have dulled expectations for China's economic performance in July, in an ominous sign for the rest of 2024 and pointing to the need for more stimulus measures beyond plastering over pain points in the world's second-largest economy.】

item.title: 苹果供应商富士康第二季度利润同比增长 6%，超出预期
item.description: 苹果供应商富士康周三公布，受人工智能服务器需求强劲的推动，第二季度净利润增长 6%。【原文：Apple supplier Foxconn reported on Wednesday a 6% rise in second-quarter net profit, driven by strong AI server demand.】

item.title: 欧洲最大的旅游运营商 TUI 第三季度业绩强劲，原因是夏季预订火爆
item.description: 欧洲最大的旅游运营商 TUI 周三公布的第三季度营业利润超出预期，这主要得益于强劲的夏季旅游需求和德国竞争对手 FTI 的破产。【原文：Europe's largest tour operator TUI on Wednesday beat third-quarter operating profit expectations thanks to strong summer travel demand and a boost from German rival FTI's bankruptcy.】

item.title: 迄今为止，融资条件通过了全球大跌的考验
item.description: 本月金融市场的剧烈抛售几乎没有破坏全球融资条件，但进一步波动的风险意味着借款人尚未走出困境。【原文：A tumultuous sell-off in financial markets this month has barely scathed global financing conditions, but the risk of further volatility means borrowers are not yet out of the woods.】

item.title: 一次性支出导致蒂森克虏伯出现季度净亏损
item.description: 蒂森克虏伯集团（Thyssenkrupp）周三表示，由于工厂工程业务遗留项目的成本高于预期，该集团第三财季净亏损转为亏损。【原文：Thyssenkrupp swung to a net loss in its fiscal third quarter due to higher-than-expected costs for legacy projects at its plant engineering business, the conglomerate said on Wednesday, adding it had also halted the sales process for one of its units.】

item.title: 瑞银第二季度实现净利润 11 亿美元
item.description: 瑞银集团周三公布，4-6 月份净利润为 11.4 亿美元，这是该银行与曾经的竞争对手瑞士信贷完成正式合法合并后的首份业绩报告。【原文：UBS reported on Wednesday a net profit of $1.14 billion for the April-June period, the first results since the completion of the bank's formal legal merger with its one-time rival Credit Suisse.】

item.title: 瑞银集团公布第二季度股东应占净利润为 11 亿美元
item.description: 瑞银集团周三公布，第二季度归属于股东的净利润为 11.4 亿美元，而分析师在公司提供的民意调查中预测的净利润为 5.28 亿美元。【原文：UBS Group on Wednesday reported a net profit of $1.14 billion attributable to shareholders in the second quarter, which compared with the $528 million forecast by analysts in a company-provided poll.】

item.title: 早安欢迎加入切割俱乐部，新西兰人
item.description: Stella Qiu 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Stella Qiu】

item.title: 工会能否阻止世界最大铜矿的生产？
item.description: 必和必拓（BHP）的埃斯孔迪达（Escondida）铜矿在 2023 年的产量将占全球铜产量的近 5%，该矿的罢工背后是一个强大的工会，该工会正寻求阻断该矿的生产，以争取更大的利润份额。【原文：A powerful workers union behind a strike at BHP's huge Escondida mine, which produced nearly 5% of the world's copper in 2023, is looking to snarl production at the site as it pushes for a bigger share of profits.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，士力架制造商玛氏将以每股 83.50 美元的价格收购凯兰诺华
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周二援引知情人士的话报道，家族包装食品巨头玛氏公司（旗下糖果品牌包括 M&M's 和士力架）预计将以每股 83.50 美元的价格收购食品制造商 Kellanova。【原文：Family-owned packaged food giant Mars, whose candy brands include M&M's and Snickers, is expected to pay $83.50 per share for food maker Kellanova , the Wall Street Journal reported on Tuesday citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 新西兰降息，亚洲股市上涨，新西兰元下跌
item.description: 周三，在疲软的美国生产者价格数据激起了消费者价格通胀将趋于温和的希望之后，亚洲股市上涨，美元收跌，从而导致债券收益率走低。【原文：Asian shares rose and the dollar nursed losses on Wednesday after soft U.S. producer prices data stirred hopes that consumer price inflation would be benign, sending bond yields lower.】

item.title: 新西兰中央银行四年多来首次降息，标志着未来将采取更多宽松政策
item.description: 新西兰央行周三将基准现金利率下调至5.25%，这是自2020年3月以来的首次宽松政策，并表示随着通胀率向1%至3%的目标靠拢，未来还会有更多的降息举措。【原文：New Zealand's central bank cut the benchmark cash rate to 5.25% on Wednesday, its first policy easing since March 2020 and flagged more cuts ahead as inflation was converging on its target of 1% to 3%.】
